channel.title: Commands Help

item.title: Commands Help
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Ruzuronni, post:1, topic:350257”]How do I make it so only player rights 2 and player rights 3 can use a command, I’ve done it before but forgot.

something like this

if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteleto") && c.playerRights == 3 || == 2) { String name = playerCommand.substring(8); for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(Server.playerHandler.players[i].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[i].getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[i].heightLevel); } } } }[/quote]

if(playerCommand.startsWith("xteleto") && c.playerRights == 3 || c.playerRights == 2) {

or the shortest way to do it

if(playerCommand.startsWith("xteleto") && c.playerRights > 1) {

item.title: Commands Help
item.dc:creator: @Ruzuronni Ruzuronni
item.description:
@Ruzuronni wrote:

How do I make it so only player rights 2 and player rights 3 can use a command, I’ve done it before but forgot.

something like this

if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteleto") && c.playerRights == 3 || == 2) { String name = playerCommand.substring(8); for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { c.getPA().movePlayer(Server.playerHandler.players[i].getX(), Server.playerHandler.players[i].getY(), Server.playerHandler.players[i].heightLevel); } } } }
